questions.question: In the first chapter why is the pilot released from the community

choices.answer: He was a spy from an enemy
He failed to deliver his cargo of food on time
He flew where he wasn't supposed to
He crashed his aircraft

questions.question: Why does Jonas decide that “apprehensive” is a better word for his feeling than “frightened”?

choices.answer: He wants to use more sophisticated vocabulary
He thinks it expresses more precisely how he feels
He likes words that begin with vowels
His mother used the word “apprehensive” and he admires her

questions.question: What does Jonas’s mother do for a living?

choices.answer: She is a Nurturer
She is a Storyteller
She is a Birth-mother
She works for the department of justice

questions.question: Which rule is most frequently broken in Jonas’s community?

choices.answer: Children must not ride bicycles until they are nine
Members are not allowed to look at each other naked
Air crafts are not to be flown over the community
Names of new-children are secret until the Naming Ceremony

questions.question: Why does Jonas’s mother discourage Lily from becoming a Birth mother?

choices.answer: Giving birth is dangerous,one might die from  complications
Birth mothers are very lazy and never get anything done
The position holds very little honor in the society
The society is overpopulated

questions.question: Why does Jonas worry about Asher’s Assignment?

choices.answer: Asher is easily disappointed and negative all the time
Asher does not seem to have any serious interests
Asher will fail at any Assignment he is given
Asher has not completed enough volunteer hours to qualify

questions.question: Why is Gabriel in danger of being released?

choices.answer: He bites the staff at the Nurturing Center
He is deformed
He is not growing fast enough and isn't sleeping at night
He smiles too much, and the staff suspects he is disabled

questions.question: What do the numbers assigned to each child signify?

choices.answer: The order of their birth
Their rank in school
The department to which they belong
Their height in inches

questions.question: Why does the Chief Elder apologize to the audience at the Ceremony of Twelve?

choices.answer: She is about to tell them that Jonas will be released
She has caused them anxiety about Jonas’s Assignment
Her shoes do not match her handbag
She knows they are disappointed with their job assignments

questions.question: How does the community react to the death of a child in the river?

choices.answer: They hold a candlelight vigil
They send casseroles to the child’s parents
They hold seminars to warn kids to stay away from the river
They chant the child’s name; each time more and more softly

questions.question: Where did the Giver get his wisdom?

choices.answer: From his own experience
From reading books
From memories transmitted by the previous Receiver
From a surgical operation

questions.question: Which of the following was not written on Jonas’s Assignment sheet?

choices.answer: You are permitted to lie
You are not permitted to apply for release
You are not permitted to apply for a spouse
You are exempted from rules governing rudeness

questions.question: What method does the Giver use to train Jonas?

choices.answer: He places his hands on Jonas’s back and gives him memories
He burns Jonas with a hot iron until Jonas can endure pain
He teaches Jonas to read novels with a critical eye
He shows Jonas videos of events that happened in the past

questions.question: What is the first memory Jonas receives?

choices.answer: A ride on a sled through falling snow
A sunburn
A family at Christmas
A ride on a sled resulting in a broken leg

questions.question: Why is Lily skeptical of Jonas’s story about the elephants?

choices.answer: She thinks Jonas is just trying to scare her
Jonas is a pathological liar
Lily thinks elephants are imaginary creatures
Lily is an expert on elephants

questions.question: What was the name of the failed Receiver who was chosen ten years ago?

choices.answer: Poppy
Melanie
Fiona
Rosemary

questions.question: Why is Jonas not permitted to apply for release?

choices.answer: All the valuable time spent on his training would be wasted
All of the Committee of Elders would die of broken hearts
All the memories would be released and create chaos
If Jonas left, the Giver would be lonely

questions.question: How does Jonas help the new child Gabriel go to sleep?

choices.answer: He transmits memories of lullabies and soft beds
He tells him bedtime stories
He transmits memories of peaceful sails on a lake
He injects him with a mild sleeping drug

questions.question: Why do Jonas’s parents refuse to tell him that they love him?

choices.answer: They think that Jonas will feel smothered by their love
They secretly hate him
They think love is an obsolete word with no meaning
They were not paying attention when he asked

questions.question: Why does Jonas interrupt his friends’ game of good guys and bad guys?

choices.answer: They did not let him play
They are not following the rules governing game play
He has a better idea for a game
He recognizes that they act too casual about war and death

questions.question: Why does the Nurturing Center release one of every set of identical twins?

choices.answer: The staff is sadistic
It is inconvenient to have identical people walking around
They need to practice their releasing techniques
One twin is always seriously ill at birth

questions.question: Why does Jonas leave the community before the time he and the Giver had planned?

choices.answer: He realizes that the Giver is a liar
He finds out that Gabriel will be released the next morning
The wind is good, and he needs to take a boat
He wants to bring Fiona; he knows the Giver wouldn't approve

questions.question: How does Jonas keep the search planes from finding him and Gabriel?

choices.answer: He covers their bodies with thick, dirty leaves
He bribes one of the Pilots to ignore them
He transmits memories of cold so their body temps fall
He stays very still because they are motion-sensitive

questions.question: What does Jonas see (or think he sees) as he nears the bottom of the hill on the sled?

choices.answer: Colored lights in the windows of houses
His parents waiting for him
A search party from the community
A child with a broken leg who has fallen from his sled
